title: Microsoftâ€™s Clipchamp video editor now lets you create 1080p videos for free
content:
The included video editor in Windows 11, Clipchamp, is getting a long-overdue improvement following its lackluster initial launch. Microsoft is bringing support for 1080p video exports to the free tier of Clipchamp, meaning you no longer have to pay a premium for what should be a relatively basic feature. Clipchamp is a cloud-based video editor

The post Microsoft’s Clipchamp video editor now lets you create 1080p videos for free appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Microsoft is bringing the long-overdue capability to export 1080p videos to the free tier of Clipchamp, but prices are the same for now.
